name: 1.7: "Friends, Romans and Accountants" Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: In the cold opening, what was Meesha doing with his hands?
options: tapping to the song that's in his head
questions.explanation:
counting out a long rest.

	Sam said he played the cymbals for an orchestra and had to count out a long rest to know when to get back to play. Diane upset the man when she counted the change out loud throwing off his count. He then had to leave without drinking all of his beer.

questions.text: Who suggested Norm throw a toga party?
questions.explanation:
Diane.

	At first Diane suggested that Norm throw a party in which everyone would dress up as their favorite Elizabethan poet. They all teased her so she suggested a toga party, which Norm liked and decided to do.

questions.text: Who dressed up in a toga?
questions.explanation:
Just Norm.

	The other accountants didn't think anyone else would do it so they all chickened out. Norm said he knew they could read because they all got the date right.

questions.text: Why wasn't Norm's wife at the party?
options: She and Norm were separated at this time.
questions.explanation:
She didn't hear about it.

	Norm avoided his wife Vera as much as possible. He never told her about the party so she wouldn't be there to nag him.

questions.text: What did Diane suggest they play?
options: Pin the tail on the donkey
questions.explanation:
Charades.

	Diane's clue was "My Dinner with..." Coach guessed Julius LaRosa. Diane gave up and said, "That's it".

questions.text: Who was the girl Norm originally had to come entertain the boss?
questions.explanation:
Rudda.

	Norm was very distraught when Rudda called and said she couldn't make it. Sam suggested he ask one of the women at the bar.

questions.text: Who ended up being the boss' woman for the party?
questions.explanation:
Diane.

	Diane was offended that Norm would suggest she do such a thing at first. But then she saw how handsome his boss was and quickly changed her mind.

questions.text: Who played Norm's boss, Mr. Sawyer?
questions.explanation:
James Read.

	James Read was born July 31, 1953. He is best known for his role in the miniseries "North and South".

questions.text: When the band leader asked for requests, who gave him a request?
options: Everyone shouted requests at the same time
questions.explanation:
The cymbals' player.

	The cymbals player suggested "Chicago" to which the leader replied, "One of Eddie's favorites." The accountants at the party were very stiff and didn't want to do anything fun.

questions.text: What was Mr. Sawyer's first name?
questions.explanation:
Herb.

	Diane asked Sam, "It doesn't bother you at all that I'm spending time with Herb?" Sam said he wasn't bothered but he was afraid that the man might have ulterior motives. Diane accused Sam of being jealous that there was another good looking man in the bar.
